name: Albertson conjecture
rephrased: Among all graphs requiring n colors, the complete graph K_n has the highest crossing number.
implication_form: If a graph has chromatic number less than n, then it can be drawn with fewer crossings than the complete graph K_n.
explained: The Albertson conjecture states that for any integer n, the complete graph K_n has the maximum crossing number among all graphs with chromatic number n. In other words, any graph requiring n colors must have a crossing number at least equal to that of K_n. This implies that K_n minimizes the crossing number for graphs with chromatic number n.
